intro: Galium diphyllum, commonly known as two-leaved bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous perennial native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and usually oval or elliptic in shape. Galium diphyllum thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
